Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxopoly.angeliacore.model.inventory.Inventory

    java.lang.Iterable<ItemStack>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnvilInventory, BeaconInventory, BrewingStandInventory, ChestInventory, CraftingTableInventory, DispenserInventory, DummyInventory, EnchantmentTableInventory, FurnaceInventory, HopperInventory, PlayerInventory

extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<ItemStack>

      • updateCursor

        public static void updateCursor​(ItemStack is)

      • compress

        public Inventory compress()
        Compresses this instance by combining all ItemStacks in it which are identical and adjusting amounts accordingly
        Returns:
        Compressed version of this inventory with a variable size

      • findSlot

        public short findSlot​(ItemStack is)
        Looks for the given item in any slot of this inventory. If the item is found, the index of the first find is returned, otherwise -1 is returned. Note that in other context the slot -1 might stand for the cursor, but that's not the case here
        Parameters:
        is - ItemStack to look for
        Returns:
        Slot of the first find of the stack or -1 if none was found

      • findSlotByType

        public short findSlotByType​(ItemStack is)
        Looks for the given item id in any slot of this inventory. If the item is found, the index of the first find is returned, otherwise -1 is returned. Note that in other context the slot -1 might stand for the cursor, but that's not the case here
        Parameters:
        is - id of the ItemStack to look for
        Returns:
        Slot of the first find of the item id or -1 if none was found

      • getHotbar

        public DummyInventory getHotbar()
        Returns:
        The hotbar slots in this inventory

      • getPlayerHotbarStartingSlot

        protected int getPlayerHotbarStartingSlot()

      • getPlayerStorage

        public DummyInventory getPlayerStorage()
        Returns:
        The player storage slots, so the 27 normal inventory slots + the hotbar

      • getPlayerStorageStartingSlot

        protected abstract int getPlayerStorageStartingSlot()

      • getPlayerStorageWithoutHotbar

        public DummyInventory getPlayerStorageWithoutHotbar()
        Returns:
        The player storage slots, so the 27 normal inventory slots, but not the hotbar

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        How many slots this inventory has total

      • getSlot

        public ItemStack getSlot​(int id)
        Gets the content of the slot with the given id. If the slot is empty, a dummy ItemStack with an id of -1 is returned
        Parameters:
        id - Slot id
        Returns:
        ItemStack representing the content of the selected slot

      • getWindowID

        public byte getWindowID()

      • hasSpaceFor

        public boolean hasSpaceFor​(ItemStack is)
        Checks whether the given ItemStack fits into this inventory by filling up existing stacks and using empty slot as available
        Parameters:
        is - ItemStack to try
        Returns:
        True if the ItemStack would fit in the inventory, false if not

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        After opening an inventory, it's content is sent in a separate packet. If this packet was received yet and the content of this chest is known, this will be true
        Returns:
        Whether the chest content is initialized

      • iterator

      • translateHotbarToTotal

        public short translateHotbarToTotal​(int slot)
        Translates a slot in the hotbar of the inventory to an absolute slot in the inventory
        Parameters:
        slot - Relative slot in the hotbar section
        Returns:
        Absolute slot

      • translateStorageSlotToTotal

        Parameters:

        Returns:
